meanings.definition: Enlist (someone) compulsorily, typically into the armed services.
meanings.sent1: During the war, many young men were conscripted into the army.
meanings.sent2: The government conscripted citizens to join the military during the conflict.
meanings.sent3: The army conscripted all able-bodied individuals, even the reluctant ones.
meanings.sent4: The idea of being conscripted into battle filled him with fear.
meanings.sent5: She vividly remembered the day she was conscripted into the navy.

meanings.definition: A person who has been conscripted.
meanings.sent1: The conscripted soldiers trained hard for their upcoming deployment.
meanings.sent2: He was proud to serve as a conscripted member of the military.
meanings.sent3: The conscripted individual found unexpected camaraderie among fellow soldiers.
meanings.sent4: As a conscripted soldier, he felt a sense of duty to his country.
meanings.sent5: The conscripted recruit quickly adapted to military life.
